Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher K. Lalonde was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.
All financials same as noted above.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Christopher K. Lalonde in court with attorney Ronald D. Haacke.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea Questionnaire filed w/NC plea to amend count.  ADA Niemi amends to misdemeanor and makes recommendation.  Court reviews rights, charges & penalties w/DE.  Court accepts waiver, plea, amendment, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty. Closing statements.
Pre-trial conference on December 16, 2014 at 08:15 am.
